verbatim_example: Tried to cold turkey but failed
Tried to cold turkey but failed
Sacrificed it to a fairly lame relapse
I find myself isolating - staying away from people, often thinking that I will reintegrate once I have solved the problem / been clean long enough that I can confidently say that it's in the past
fear a benzo rattle could push me
having to learn a totally new skill
Being alive and awake feel like a chore. A pain. A challenge with no reward. The more I think about it, the more I hope I won't wake up in the morning. This is turning into suicidal fantasy.
heroin always takes me to a much darker hell than whatever I'm trying to run from

I hated myself during that long time of abuse, but I tried to mask the depression and anxiety with more pills. ... I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, and now sleep on and off an hour at a time. My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom, but it doesn't do much in regards to anxiety. Right now I imagine that the benzo W/Ds are still most of it, but because I have put myself through so much mental anguish, I don't know if I am simply creating anxiety.
I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse
I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me... Going outside feels so terrifying, esp when I am physically shaking and in constant cold sweats.
The first two weeks were absolutely brutal, I could barely function, I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, I was extremely paranoid, it truly was hell
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks
I know that drugs are temporary and make you worse off in the long run
The drugs kept me so numb to the pain. This is fucking me up. I don't like these fucking real emotions I'm feeling
Drugs are a choice that turns into a disease. It rewires your brain into the desire and urge we call addiction. ... this disease that destroys who we are at our core
can't handle the restless legs at night. I can't deal
The wrestless legs still won't quit
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad
I am scared bc I know I will want to use. I am scared bc I am already in pain and want to use.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia
I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax
I have 70 something days clean. I've never used a needle. Why? Seriously. I just want a 'normal' friend. This is just so tempting. Just for today, I will not relapse.
it was hard, so hard to actually deal with all that pain, and all of those emotions
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal
Horrible first experience with subs, puking
couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel
could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia
manipulating a doctor to give a heroin addict more morphine
only 3-4 hours of sleep last night. Forced down a small meal and vitamins this morning
Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided, emotions aren't as bad this morning but I'm definitely not Mr Perky
Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging
emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad
the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass

I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently. I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day. I still can't sleep well but I'm grabbing more random spurts of it. I still feel emotionally flatlined

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.

Still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off. Still can't totally relax without some restless feet. Lingering anhedonia that comes in waves. Still sorta anxious about the feeling of not enjoying day to day life things that I used to.
pumping some natural feel good into my body
GI is still a little weird but subsides after 2 morning trips. Restless in the evening, or whenever I lay down in general
Two morning GI episodes. Only really annoying thing left from the physical side is clammy hands, feet, pits.

it hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay, the whole nine. In the moment it felt like I went all the way back to day 2, looking for an escape from the torture that was day 1-4
a few cases of the clammy sweats
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits, anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync
can't sleep. but I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite. ... missing her hurts so bad, but being off dope feels so good
losing everything i care about, having bad thoughts
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain.

I'm in such a hole that I think there might just be one way out. I haven't been using for almost two months. But this guy will kill me or fuck me up. I'm a constant disappointment to myself and others that I love. I want to die.
Each one is one closer to being better
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way. Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least
Almost got four days but I want to sleep so. Badly.

I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly. I know this makes me sound like a pussy but I was this close to killing myself.

This is incredibly dangerous and stupid! You have no idea what kind of bacteria/infection/anything these people have in their piss! Do NOT put any piss back into your bladder! This is how you get a serious infection, fuck up your bladder, and become incontinent, and have to wear diapers the rest of your life.

the last 3 shipments I've gotten have all been tainted with something and have made both me and people close to me very ill. My sister even had to go to the hospital for whatever it was. All of us are okay now, but the sickness lasted about a week and included symptoms like incredibly high fever, delirium, really bad and burning shits, and general lethargicness

It got bad very quickly.  I used every day for about a month.  I was stealing and pawning my mom's jewelry to get money for dope.  It wasn't long before my family caught on to me nodding out everywhere, and eventually noticed her jewelry was missing... Shit got real, real fast.

I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could still drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.
staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person

My muscles twitch and roll, like someone has attached strings and pulls on them randomly for kicks. I'm also ice cold, is that a withdrawal thing? ... Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles, no appetite so I'm weak, and holy crap, does anyone else have a backache from hell?

the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much
where the pills were not enough. It was either cut the shit, or go full junkie

No matter how careful and strong-willed you may have be, you can't account for life throwing you a shit roll. You have already created these direct paths in your brain that lead to not just euphoria, but contentment, a lack of depression & anxiety, FEELING GOOD.

i had so many close calls with this shit. the day i learned what pwd was, i had an interview for a promotion. i got the job, but the pwd started as i was being interviewed. ended up not showing up for work for two days because i was so sick until i figured out what was going on.

but they just don't take all the sickness away. they definitely make me feel better, just not 100%. if i eat like two whole strips i get relief for a really short amount of time, maybe six hours max. four mg used to have me set for a full 24 hours. and that's during heavier use than now.
